snippet: Miya Thomas was removed from her mother’s home when she was 5 years old. Now 20, she is supporting herself with work, school and plans for a career in law enforcement.
abstract: Children’s Aid Society, one of the seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, provides 20-year old Miya Thomas with money towards rent on her supportive housing unit in the Bronx as she emerges from foster care system.
lead_paragraph: Miya Thomas was removed from her mother’s home when she was 5 years old. Now 20, she is supporting herself with work, school and plans for a career in law enforcement.

headline.print_headline: After Years in Foster Care, Creating a New Home
headline.main: After Years in Foster Care, Creating a New Home
